text:
Christmas and New Year’s at Four Seasons Hotel Ritz Lisbon Published on : Friday, October 9, 2015
Visitors to Lisbon are encouraged to look past the cobbled alleyways and traditional tiled facades to discover a more eclectic ensemble of stories, styles and surprises in the city.
Those looking to check off their holiday wish list in style need look no further than Lisbon. Behind rich Rococo shop-fronts and wonderful time-warp interiors one can find some of the most delightfully vintage-packaged goods, soaps in colourful art deco boxes, twinkling sardine tins, retro 1930s packets, exquisitely handmade leather gloves, delicate filigree jewellery, bespoke hats and artisanal candles.
The Portuguese capital, renowned for its seafood and custard tarts, is also a burgeoning foodie destination that will surprise even the most well-travelled of gourmands, and this holiday season Executive Chef Pascal Meynard has prepared a selection of gourmet dining offerings, which both family and friends will enjoy at Four Seasons Hotel Ritz Lisbon.
Christmas Eve Dinner at Varanda Restaurant
The classic Christmas Eve Dinner on December 24, which will take place in the Hotel’s sophisticated Varanda Restaurant, will include creative gourmet selections such as seared duck foie gras, roasted blue lobster with black truffles, the traditional codfish – confit with sweet garlic, brandade and clam crystalline – and a delicious braised venison filet with juniper berries. For dessert, Pastry Chef Fabian Nguyen has created exquisite red fruit and hibiscus spheres with fleur de sel and gianduja crispy with yuzu sorbet.
Christmas Day Brunch
Friends and family will feel at home in the Hotel’s Grand Ballroom for a sumptuous Christmas Day Buffet Brunch, which will feature a host of different dining options, from salads and casseroles to sushi and seafood stations, with roasted suckling pig, orange sauce and lavender; turbot snacké with crab broth and walnut; and a 12-hour veal confit with chestnuts and girolle mushrooms being some of the highlights of the meat and fish sections. For dessert, traditional egg pastries, Portuguese bolo-rei and French toast are there to please the sweet tooth.
Source:- Four Seasons
